--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "kirkandsheila" <kirk@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,=

> 
> I'm doing some research to determine what products/projects are out
>=
 there to perform historical/statistical/trend analysis on JUnit
> results.=
 Ideally, I'd like to be able to break down the JUnit results
> that can be=
 filtered, aggregated, and so forth for reports.
> 
> I've seen posts that =
promote/suggest Clover and Agitar. I've seen
> several posts that inquire o=
f free or open source solutions, but
> without many answers - plus they're =
a year or two old. I'm still not
> sure if Clover is what I'm looking for (=
I want to see the results for
> test run success/failure/time/regressions/e=
tc., not the coverage of
> the product in terms of unit tests).
> 
> Are th=
ere any products/projects out there to perform reporting on
> JUnit runs be=
sides Agitar?
> 
> Thanks,
> Kirk
>
Just use ant!

Create a custom xsl tran=
sformation to extract the statistics you want
from the junit report to a pr=
operties file:

<xslt in=3D"${reports.tests}/TEST-org.foo.AllTests.xml"
out=
=3D"AllTests.properties" style=3D"./testreport.xsl" />

Read the properties=
:
<property file=3D"AllTests.properties" />

Write them to a text file with=
 a timestamp
<echo file=3D"${history.txt}" append=3D"true">
${date.time};al=
ltests.count;${alltests.count}
${date.time};alltests.fails.count;${alltests=
.fails.count}
${date.time};alltests.success.count;${alltests.success.count}=

</echo>

Now use a statistical analysis tool of choice (say a spreadsheet)=
 to
analyse the log.

A similar technique can be used for any ant task that=
 produces an xml
format report eg. cobertura-report for code coverage.

/St=
even
